Instruction: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until it reaches 194 degrees F (90 degrees C) on an instant-read thermometer, approximately 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Combine lemon juice and salt with warmed milk, allowing it to sit until curdled, approximately 10 to 15 minutes.

Strain the curdled milk mixture through a cheesecloth-lined fine-mesh strainer set over a large bowl. Allow the ricotta to drain for approximately 15 minutes, until most of the liquid has been released. Remove and discard the drained liquid.
